This modal contains a dropdown labeled 'Actions' with a placeholder text 'Select...' and a blue 'Save' button below it. The background content, including credit details and navigation menus, is dimmed and not interactive while the modal is open.

assertion_checking.observation: To validate the assertion, I would expect to see an actions menu or dialog appear on the screen after clicking the 'More Actions' dropdown button. This menu should be clearly visible and distinct from the rest of the page content.
assertion_checking.verification: There is a modal dialog titled 'Credits Actions Preferences' prominently displayed in the center of the screen. It contains an actionable dropdown labeled 'Actions,' which matches what would be expected from an actions menu opening after clicking 'More Actions.'

assertor_results.query: Wait until the page finishes loading and interactive elements are visible.

synthesis.page_description: The page is the 'Edit Credit' screen of the Invoice Ninja web application. The left sidebar contains navigation links for various modules such as Dashboard, Clients, Products, Invoices, Credits (currently selected), Projects, Tasks, Vendors, Purchase Orders, Expenses, Recurring Expenses, Transactions, and Reports. The main content area displays breadcrumb navigation ('Credits > Edit Credit'), a set of tabs (Edit, Documents, Settings, Activity, History), and an editable form with fields for credit details: Status (currently 'Draft'), company name placeholder ('company_name'), client contact information ('first_name last_name', email@example.com), credit date (25/08/2025), valid until date (empty), partial/deposit field (empty), credit number (123456), PO # (empty), discount field. Below this is an itemized table with columns for Item Name ('product_n'), Description ('product_description'), Unit Cost ($60,000.00), Quantity (1), and Line Total ($60,000.00). At the top right are buttons for 'Purchase White Label', 'Save', and a dropdown arrow next to Save.

assertion_checking.observation: To validate the assertion that the page has finished loading and interactive elements are visible: I would expect to see all primary UI components rendered without loading spinners or overlays; interactive elements such as buttons and dropdowns should be clearly visible and not disabled or obscured.
assertion_checking.verification: The screenshot shows that all main UI components are fully rendered: navigation sidebar is present; form fields are visible and populated; action buttons like 'Save' and its dropdown arrow are clearly displayed; no loading indicators or overlays are present anywhere on the page.
